page.title: 02A walk through Bourton
page.content: Many thousands of visitors come to {Bourton-on-the-Water}from all parts of the world to enjoy the delightful charm of this{Cotswold}stone village with its wide green, broad, shallow stream and graceful small bridges. The largely 18th century{Church of St. {Lawrence}stands on the site of a{Roman {temple}and the{Fosseway}passes just to the west of the village. In addition to the attractive stone houses there are numerous hotels, inns, restaurants and cafes. The clear{River Windrush}has been directed through the centre of the village and passes beneath the parapets of low, arched stone bridges which form one of the main attractions of the village. It is shaded by trees and the wide green provides visitors with an opportunity for a restful break in their sightseeing.
